page.title: 13RECREATION 2
page.content: Curling is the latest sport to catch on in Pitlochry with a rink opening in 1982, though for those playing several times a week it can be quite expensive - a sheet of ice for eight players costs Â£28, for a game lasting two and a quarter hours. Equipment, however, is not too costly: a brush, needed for sweeping the ice and keeping the stone on line, costs Â£15, while a slider kit , smooth soled footwear, is around Â£10. The object of the game is to get your stones closer to the centre of the house than your opponents'.With the "skip" in the "house" telling the players what to do, the stone is played and the sweepers get busy. The sport gets ite name because you turn the stone to make it "curl" round other stones. It is a much more difficult than it looks.
